intro: Ruschia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in winter. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is widely cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions.
